arg-definition.name: space
arg-definition.documentation: A 'space' is a collection of documents with the same schema and logic; space names must have a length greater than 3 and less than 128, have valid characters are lower-case alphanumeric or hyphens, and double hyphens (--) are not allowed.

arg-definition.name: rxhtml-path
arg-definition.documentation: The path to scan for RxHTML files.

arg-definition.name: microverse
arg-definition.documentation: The microverse plan which defines the local devbox solo mode.

arg-definition.name: asset-path
arg-definition.documentation: The path to map for static assets.

arg-definition.name: local-libadama-path
arg-definition.documentation: The path to the libadama.js source code for direct linkage.

arg-definition.name: base
arg-definition.documentation: The base directory for working with edhtml.

arg-definition.name: gc
arg-definition.documentation: Delete assets that were not present in this upload.

arg-definition.name: key
arg-definition.documentation: A document key; keys must have a length greater than 0 and less than 512; valid characters are A-Z, a-z, 0-9, underscore (_), hyphen (-i), or period (.).

arg-definition.name: route
arg-definition.documentation: Should the domain route to the key's handler.

arg-definition.name: marker
arg-definition.documentation: Items greater than the marker are returned.

arg-definition.name: authority
arg-definition.documentation: The name or key of a keystore.

arg-definition.name: agent
arg-definition.documentation: The user id or agent part of a principal.

arg-definition.name: keystore
arg-definition.documentation: A special JSON encoded keystore holding only public keys.

arg-definition.name: priv
arg-definition.documentation: A special JSON encoded private key

arg-definition.name: auto
arg-definition.documentation: Should the Adama Platform automatically get a domain.

arg-definition.name: target
arg-definition.documentation: A target is a combination of ip address and port.
